case.name: dcs
case.title: Diatomic closed-shell molecules
case.qn: a label identifying the electronic state: X, A, a, B, etc.
the vibrational quantum number
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum excluding nuclear spin, J

the intermediate angular momentum quantum number associated with the coupling of the rotational angular momentum and nuclear spin of nucleus 1 where two such couplings are resolved: F1 = J + I1; F1 is often not a good quantum number
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum including nuclear spin: F = J + I1 if only one such coupling is resolved, F = F1 + I2 if both couplings are resolved
a named, positive integer label identifying the state if no other good quantum numbers or symmetries are known

the total parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction (excluding nuclear spin) with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system, the E* operation

(for diatomic molecules with a centre of inversion) the symmetry of the rovibronic wavefunction: 'a' or 's' such that the total wavefunction including nuclear spin is symmetric or antisymmetric with respect to permutation of the identical nuclei (P_12), according to whether they are bosons or fermions respectively

case.name: hunda
case.title: Hund's case (a) diatomics
case.qn: a label identifying the electronic state: X, A, a, B, etc.
the parity of the electronic wavefunction with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass in the molecular coordinate system

the parity of the electronic wavefunction with respect to reflection in a plane containing the molecular symmetry axis in the molecular coordinate system (equivalent to inversion through the molecular centre of mass in the laboratory coordinate system)
the quantum number associated with the magnitude of the projection of the total electronic orbital angular momentum, L, onto the molecular axis
the quantum number associated with the magnitude of the projection of S onto the molecular axis

the quantum number associated with the projection of the total angular momentum (excluding nuclear spin), J, onto the molecular axis: Omega = |Lambda + Sigma| (or Omega = |Lambda| + Sigma if S > |Lambda| > 0)
the quantum number associated with the total electronic spin angular momentum, S
the vibrational quantum number
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum excluding nuclear spin: J=L+S+R

the intermediate angular momentum quantum number associated with the coupling of the rotational angular momentum and nuclear spin of nucleus 1 where two such couplings are resolved: F1 = J + I1; F1 is often not a good quantum number
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum including nuclear spin: F = J + I1 if only one such coupling is resolved, F = F1 + I2 if both couplings are resolved
a named, positive integer label identifying the state if no other good quantum numbers or symmetries are known

the total parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction (excluding nuclear spin) with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system, the E* operation

the 'rotationless' parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction excluding nuclear spin and rotation with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system

(for diatomic molecules with a centre of inversion) the symmetry of the rovibronic wavefunction: 'a' or 's' such that the total wavefunction including nuclear spin is symmetric or antisymmetric with respect to permutation of the identical nuclei (P_12), according to whether they are bosons or fermions respectively

case.name: hundb
case.title: Hund's case (b) diatomics
case.qn: a label identifying the electronic state: X, A, a, B, etc.
the parity of the electronic wavefunction with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass in the molecular coordinate system

the parity of the electronic wavefunction with respect to reflection in a plane containing the molecular symmetry axis in the molecular coordinate system (equivalent to inversion through the molecular centre of mass in the laboratory coordinate system)
the quantum number associated with the magnitude of the projection of the total electronic orbital angular momentum, L, onto the molecular axis
the quantum number associated with the total electronic spin angular momentum, S
the vibrational quantum number
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum excluding nuclear spin: J = N + S = L + S + R
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum excluding electronic and nuclear spin, N: J = N + S

the positive integer identifying the spin-component label, Fx, where x=1,2,3,... in order of increasing energy for a given value of J - see Herzberg, Spectra of Diatomic Molecules, Van Nostrand, Princeton, N.J., 1950

the intermediate angular momentum quantum number associated with the coupling of the rotational angular momentum and nuclear spin of nucleus 1 where two such couplings are resolved: F1 = J + I1; F1 is often not a good quantum number
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum including nuclear spin: F = J + I1 if only one such coupling is resolved, F = F1 + I2 if both couplings are resolved
a named, positive integer label identifying the state if no other good quantum numbers or symmetries are known

the total parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction (excluding nuclear spin) with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system, the E* operation

the 'rotationless' parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction excluding nuclear spin and rotation with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system

(for diatomic molecules with a centre of inversion) the symmetry of the rovibronic wavefunction: 'a' or 's' such that the total wavefunction including nuclear spin is symmetric or antisymmetric with respect to permutation of the identical nuclei (P_12), according to whether they are bosons or fermions respectively

case.name: ltcs
case.title: Closed-shell, linear triatomic molecules
case.qn: a label identifying the electronic state: X, A, a, B, etc.
the vibrational quantum number associated with the nu1 normal mode
the vibrational quantum number associated with the doubly-degenerate nu2 normal mode
the vibrational angular momentum quantum number associated with the degenerate bending vibration, nu2; positive and negative values distinguish l-type doubling components
the vibrational quantum number associated with the nu3 normal mode
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum excluding nuclear spin, J

the intermediate angular momentum quantum number associated with the coupling of the rotational angular momentum and nuclear spin of nucleus 1 where two or more such couplings are resolved: F1 = J + I1; F1 is often not a good quantum number

the intermediate angular momentum quantum number associated with the coupling of the rotational angular momentum and nuclear spin of nucleus 2 where three such couplings are resolved: F2 = F1 + I2; F2 is often not a good quantum number

the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum including nuclear spin: F = J + I1 if only one hyperfine coupling is resolved, F = F1 + I2 if two couplings are resolved, or F = F2 + I3 if all three couplings are resolved
a named, positive integer label identifying the state if no other good quantum numbers or symmetries are known

the total parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction (excluding nuclear spin) with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system, the E* operation

the 'rotationless' parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction excluding nuclear spin and rotation with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system

(for linear molecules with a centre of inversion) the symmetry of the rovibronic wavefunction: 'a' or 's' such that the total wavefunction including nuclear spin is symmetric or antisymmetric with respect to permutation of the identical nuclei (P_12), according to whether they are bosons or fermions respectively

case.name: nltcs
case.title: Closed-shell, non-linear triatomics
case.qn: a label identifying the electronic state: X, A, a, B, etc.
the vibrational quantum number associated with the nu1 normal mode
the vibrational quantum number associated with the nu2 normal mode
the vibrational quantum number associated with the nu3 normal mode
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum excluding nuclear spin, J
the rotational quantum label of an asymmetric top molecule, correlating to K in the prolate symmetric top limit
the rotational quantum label of an asymmetric top molecule, correlating to K in the oblate symmetric top limit

the intermediate angular momentum quantum number associated with the coupling of the rotational angular momentum and nuclear spin of nucleus 1 where two or more such couplings are resolved: F1 = J + I1; F1 is often not a good quantum number

the intermediate angular momentum quantum number associated with the coupling of the rotational angular momentum and nuclear spin of nucleus 2 where three such couplings are resolved: F2 = F1 + I2; F2 is often not a good quantum number

the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum including nuclear spin: F = J + I1 if only one hyperfine coupling is resolved, F = F1 + I2 if two couplings are resolved, or F = F2 + I3 if all three couplings are resolved
a named, positive integer label identifying the state if no other good quantum numbers or symmetries are known

the total parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction (excluding nuclear spin) with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system, the E* operation

the symmetry of the rovibronic wavefunction: 'a' or 's' such that the total wavefunction including nuclear spin is symmetric or antisymmetric with respect to permutation of the identical nuclei (P_12), according to whether they are bosons or fermions respectively

case.name: stcs
case.title: Closed shell, symmetric-top molecules
case.qn: a label identifying the electronic state
the vibrational quantum number associated with the nu_i normal mode
the vibrational angular momentum quantum number associated with the degenerate nu_i normal mode; positive and negative values distinguish l-type doubling components

the parity of the vibrational wavefunction with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass in the molecular coordinate system. Only really necessary for molecules with a low barrier to such an inversion (for example, NH3)
the symmetry species of the vibrational wavefunction, in some appropriate symmetry group
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum excluding nuclear spin, J
the quantum number associated with the projection of the total angular momentum excluding nuclear spin, J, onto the molecular symmetry axis
the symmetry species of the rotational wavefunction, in some appropriate symmetry group
the symmetry species of the rovibrational wavefunction, in some appropriate symmetry group
the quantum number associated with the total nuclear spin angular momentum: I = I1 + I2 + ... where nuclei 1, 2, ... have individual nuclear spin angular momenta I1, I2, ...

the intermediate angular momentum quantum number associated with the coupling of the nuclear spin angular momentum of nucleus j to the intermediate angular momentum: F1 = J + I1 or Fj = F(j-1) + Ij; Fj is often not a good quantum number
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum including nuclear spin: F = J + I1 if only one such coupling is resolved, F = F(j-1) + Ij if two or more such couplings are resolved
a named, positive integer label identifying the state if no other good quantum numbers or symmetries are known

the total parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction (excluding nuclear spin) with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system, the E* operation

case.name: lpcs
case.title: Closed-shell, linear polyatomic molecules
case.qn: a label identifying the electronic state
the vibrational quantum number associated with the nu_i normal mode

the vibrational angular momentum quantum number associated with the degenerate nu_i normal mode; positive and negative values distinguish l-type doubling components; if two or more degenerate vibrations are excited, li is only approximately defined (i.e. it is not a totally good quantum number) - see e.g. Herzerg II, p.212
the total vibrational angular momentum quantum number associated with resultant vibrational angular momentum about the internuclear axis
the parity of the vibrational wavefunction with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass in the molecular coordinate system
the parity of the vibrational wavefunction with respect to reflection in a plane containing the molecular symmetry axis in the molecular coordinate system
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum excluding nuclear spin, J
the quantum number associated with the total nuclear spin angular momentum: I = I1 + I2 + ... where nuclei 1, 2, ... have individual nuclear spin angular momenta I1, I2, ...

the intermediate angular momentum quantum number associated with the coupling of the nuclear spin angular momentum of nucleus j to the intermediate angular momentum: F1 = J + I1 or Fj = F(j-1) + Ij; Fj is often not a good quantum number
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum including nuclear spin: F = J + I1 if only one such coupling is resolved, F = F(j-1) + Ij if two or more such couplings are resolved
a named, positive integer label identifying the state if no other good quantum numbers or symmetries are known

the total parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction (excluding nuclear spin) with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system, the E* operation

the 'rotationless' parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction excluding nuclear spin and rotation with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system

(for linear molecules with a centre of inversion) the symmetry of the rovibronic wavefunction: 'a' or 's' such that the total wavefunction including nuclear spin is symmetric or antisymmetric with respect to permutation of the identical nuclei (P_12), according to whether they are bosons or fermions respectively

case.name: asymcs
case.title: Closed-shell, asymmetric top molecules
case.qn: a label identifying the electronic state
the vibrational quantum number associated with the nu_i normal mode
the parity of the vibrational wavefunction with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass in the molecular coordinate system.
the symmetry species of the vibrational wavefunction, in some appropriate symmetry group
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum excluding nuclear spin, J
the rotational quantum label of an asymmetric top molecule, correlating to K in the prolate symmetric top limit
the rotational quantum label of an asymmetric top molecule, correlating to K in the oblate symmetric top limit
the symmetry species of the rotational wavefunction, in some appropriate symmetry group
the symmetry species of the rovibrational wavefunction, in some appropriate symmetry group
the quantum number associated with the total nuclear spin angular momentum: I = I1 + I2 + ... where nuclei 1, 2, ... have individual nuclear spin angular momenta I1, I2, ...

the intermediate angular momentum quantum number associated with the coupling of the nuclear spin angular momentum of nucleus j to the intermediate angular momentum: F1 = J + I1 or Fj = F(j-1) + Ij; Fj is often not a good quantum number
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum including nuclear spin: F = J + I1 if only one such coupling is resolved, F = F(j-1) + Ij if two or more such couplings are resolved
a named, positive integer label identifying the state if no other good quantum numbers or symmetries are known

the total parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction (excluding nuclear spin) with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system, the E* operation

case.name: asymos
case.title: Open-shell, asymmetric top molecules
case.qn: a label identifying the electronic state
the symmetry species of the electronic wavefunction described by some symmetry group.
the parity of the electronic wavefunction with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass in the molecular coordinate system.
the quantum number associated with the total electronic spin angular momentum, S
the vibrational quantum number associated with the nu_i normal mode
the parity of the vibrational wavefunction with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass in the molecular coordinate system.
the symmetry species of the vibrational wavefunction, in some appropriate symmetry group
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum excluding nuclear spin, J
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum excluding electronic and nuclear spin, N: J = N + S
the rotational quantum label of an asymmetric top molecule, correlating to K in the prolate symmetric top limit
the rotational quantum label of an asymmetric top molecule, correlating to K in the oblate symmetric top limit
the symmetry species of the rotational wavefunction, in some appropriate symmetry group
the symmetry species of the rovibrational wavefunction, in some appropriate symmetry group
the quantum number associated with the total nuclear spin angular momentum: I = I1 + I2 + ... where nuclei 1, 2, ... have individual nuclear spin angular momenta I1, I2, ...

the intermediate angular momentum quantum number associated with the coupling of the nuclear spin angular momentum of nucleus j to the intermediate angular momentum: F1 = J + I1 or Fj = F(j-1) + Ij; Fj is often not a good quantum number
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum including nuclear spin: F = J + I1 if only one such coupling is resolved, F = F(j-1) + Ij if two or more such couplings are resolved
a named, positive integer label identifying the state if no other good quantum numbers or symmetries are known

the total parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction (excluding nuclear spin) with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system, the E* operation

case.title: Closed-shell, spherical-top molecules

the vibrational quantum number associated with the nu_i normal mode
the vibrational angular momentum quantum number associated with the degenerate nu_i normal mode; positive and negative values distinguish l-type doubling components
the symmetry species of the vibrational wavefunction, in some appropriate symmetry group
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum excluding nuclear spin, J
the symmetry species of the rotational wavefunction, in some appropriate symmetry group
the symmetry species of the rovibrational wavefunction, in some appropriate symmetry group
the quantum number associated with the total nuclear spin angular momentum: I = I1 + I2 + ... where nuclei 1, 2, ... have individual nuclear spin angular momenta I1, I2, ...

the intermediate angular momentum quantum number associated with the coupling of the nuclear spin angular momentum of nucleus j to the intermediate angular momentum: F1 = J + I1 or Fj = F(j-1) + Ij; Fj is often not a good quantum number
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum including nuclear spin: F = J + I1 if only one such coupling is resolved, F = F(j-1) + Ij if two or more such couplings are resolved
a named, positive integer label identifying the state if no other good quantum numbers or symmetries are known

the total parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction (excluding nuclear spin) with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system, the E* operation

case.title: Open-shell, spherical-top molecules
case.qn: a label identifying the electronic state
the symmetry species of the electronic wavefunction described by some symmetry group.

the quantum number associated with the total electronic spin angular momentum, S

the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum including nuclear spin: F = J + I1 if only one such coupling is resolved, F = F(j-1) + Ij if two or more such couplings are resolved
a named, positive integer label identifying the state if no other good quantum numbers or symmetries are known

the total parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction (excluding nuclear spin) with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system, the E* operation

case.name: ltos
case.title: Open-shell,linear triatomic molecules
case.qn: a label identifying the electronic state: X, A, a, B, etc.
the parity of the electronic wavefunction with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass in the molecular coordinate system

the parity of the electronic wavefunction with respect to reflection in a plane containing the molecular symmetry axis in the molecular coordinate system (equivalent to inversion through the molecular centre of mass in the laboratory coordinate system)

the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum excluding nuclear spin, J

the intermediate angular momentum quantum number associated with the coupling of the rotational angular momentum and nuclear spin of nucleus 1 where two or more such couplings are resolved: F1 = J + I1; F1 is often not a good quantum number

the intermediate angular momentum quantum number associated with the coupling of the rotational angular momentum and nuclear spin of nucleus 2 where three such couplings are resolved: F2 = F1 + I2; F2 is often not a good quantum number

the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum including nuclear spin: F = J + I1 if only one hyperfine coupling is resolved, F = F1 + I2 if two couplings are resolved, or F = F2 + I3 if all three couplings are resolved
a named, positive integer label identifying the state if no other good quantum numbers or symmetries are known

the total parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction (excluding nuclear spin) with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system, the E* operation

the 'rotationless' parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction excluding nuclear spin and rotation with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system

(for linear molecules with a centre of inversion) the symmetry of the rovibronic wavefunction: 'a' or 's' such that the total wavefunction including nuclear spin is symmetric or antisymmetric with respect to permutation of the identical nuclei (P_12), according to whether they are bosons or fermions respectively

the parity of the electronic wavefunction with respect to reflection in a plane containing the molecular symmetry axis in the molecular coordinate system (equivalent to inversion through the molecular centre of mass in the laboratory coordinate system)
the quantum number associated with the total electronic spin angular momentum, S
the vibrational quantum number associated with the nu_i normal mode

the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum excluding nuclear spin, J
the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum excluding electronic and nuclear spin, N: J = N + S
the quantum number associated with the total nuclear spin angular momentum: I = I1 + I2 + ... where nuclei 1, 2, ... have individual nuclear spin angular momenta I1, I2, ...

the quantum number associated with the total angular momentum including nuclear spin: F = J + I1 if only one such coupling is resolved, F = F(j-1) + Ij if two or more such couplings are resolved
a named, positive integer label identifying the state if no other good quantum numbers or symmetries are known

the total parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction (excluding nuclear spin) with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system, the E* operation

the 'rotationless' parity: the parity of the total molecular wavefunction excluding nuclear spin and rotation with respect to inversion through the molecular centre of mass of all particles' coordinates in the laboratory coordinate system
